overview.tax_residency_rules: Determined by a habitual residence test considering factors such as permanent home, family ties, and economic interests.

personal_income_tax.foreign_income_taxed: Yes, unless a double taxation agreement applies.
personal_income_tax.exemptions: Certain social benefits and scholarships are exempt.

corporate_tax.small_business_rate: 17% for businesses with annual revenue below €250,000.
corporate_tax.foreign_income_taxed: Yes, but foreign tax credits may apply.
corporate_tax.deductions: Business expenses, depreciation, research & development costs.

capital_gains_tax.exemptions: Gains from the sale of primary residence are exempt.

vat_gst.reduced_rate: 13% on certain goods and services, such as food and beverages.

property_tax.exemptions: Primary residence (up to a certain value).

digital_nomad_visa.requirements: Proof of income of at least €2,820 per month or €33,840 per year.
digital_nomad_visa.tax_benefits: Flat income tax rate of 20% for non-habitual residents for a period of 10 years.

special_economic_zones.name: Madeira Free Trade Zone
special_economic_zones.tax_incentives: Reduced corporate tax rate of 5% for businesses in certain industries.
special_economic_zones.setup_requirements: Minimum investment of €750,000 or creation of 10 jobs.

special_economic_zones.name: Sines Free Trade Zone
special_economic_zones.tax_incentives: Reduced corporate tax rate of 10% for businesses in certain industries.
special_economic_zones.setup_requirements: Minimum investment of €5 million or creation of 50 jobs.

double_taxation_agreements.description: Avoids double taxation on income and capital gains.
Avoids double taxation on income and dividends.

additional_notes.economic_stability: Portugal has a relatively stable economy with low inflation.
additional_notes.legal_system: Portugal has a well-developed legal system that protects property rights.
